text: Suppose n processes, P1,...,Pn share m identical resource units, which can be reserved and released one at a time. The maximum resource requirement of process Pi is sj, where s;>0. Which one of the following is a sufficient condition for ensuring that deadlock does not occur? (a) Vi, sicm (b) Vi, si<n (©) Xitisi < (m+mn) (d) Xy s < (mxn) BASICOPERATINGSYSTEM Paen Answers:(c) Let’s say m = 5 and n = 4 and maximum requirement of each process is p = 2 then minimum number resources required is r>=nx(p-1)+1.So,r>=4x(2-1)+1=5. Then sufficient condition for ensuring that deadlock does not occur is (c). OPTION A is not true. Here m is total number of resources available. So, if option a is satisfied, it does not ensure deadlock free. But if option a is not satisfied, surely there is a possibility of deadlock. Since if all m resources are allocated to Pi and it still needs resources, then all processes along with Pi are waiting for resources and thus blocked.
